title: Could the brutal murder of brave schoolgirl Nusrat change life for women in Bangladesh forever?
text:
With tear-filled eyes and a look of determination on their faces, every corner of the small town of Feni – south of Bangladesh’s capital - was lined with women. School girls, mothers, working women; all united in a demand for change and and to sexual violence in their country. They marched in a line, holding banners reading 'Justice for Nusrat; Justice for Bangladesh'. Others carried photographs, showing a teenage girl, unconscious, with a tube coming from her right nostril.

This girl is what had brought them together. And this week, six months later, one of Bangladesh's most high profile murder trials concluded with the sentencing of 16 men to death for the murder of 19-year-old student Nusrat...
description: With tear-filled eyes and a look of determination on their faces, every corner of the small town of Feni – south of Bangladesh’s capital - was lined with women.
